sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products formed when Potassium permanganate reacts with Hydrochloric acid? Write the balanced chemical equation for the reaction and mention the type of reaction that occurs.
message_2:
When potassium permanganate (KMnO₄) reacts with hydrochloric acid (HCl), the products formed are potassium chloride (KCl), manganese(II) chloride (MnCl₂), water (H₂O), and chlorine gas (Cl₂). The balanced chemical equation for the reaction is:

2 KMnO₄ + 16 HCl → 2 KCl + 2 MnCl₂ + 8 H₂O + 5 Cl₂

This reaction is a redox reaction (reduction-oxidation reaction) because the oxidation states of the elements change during the reaction. In this case, manganese in potassium permanganate is reduced from +7 to +2, while chlorine in hydrochloric acid is oxidized from -1 to 0.
